title.narrative: STITCH-Vietnam

description.narrative: As the Sustainable Textile Initiative: Together for Change (STITCH) consortium, we envision a global garment industry that contributes to an equal and just society by respecting human rights in the world of work. The global garment industry is fragmented and complex, involving many actors across the globe, with varying levels of power and influence. This activity relates to Fair Wear's work contributing to Vietnam under STITCH.

comment.narrative: According to ITUC’s Global Rights Index (ITUC, 2021), the situation for trade unions and freedom of association in Vietnam is unchanged from 2020 to 2021, being classified as a country with systematic violations of rights.

FW aims to conduct 50 L&A activities with different actors such as government officials, political leaders, media personnel, directly engaged brands (member brands of ETI or FW), indirectly engaged brands (not member brands of ETI or FW), TUs/ LRO and other actors towards improvement of labor rights.
